intro: Maihueniopsis minuta, commonly known as the dwarf stonecress, is a small flowering plant native to southern South America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It has a compact growth habit and produces yellow or white flowers that attract pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
